wrapper.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_WRAPPER_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_WRAPPER_HPP
00003 
00004 // (C) Copyright 2005-2006 Matthias Troyer
00005 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00006 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00007 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00008 
00009 #include <boost/serialization/traits.hpp>
00010 #include <boost/type_traits/is_base_and_derived.hpp>
00011 #include <boost/mpl/eval_if.hpp>
00012 
00013 namespace boost { namespace serialization {
00014 
00019 // is not supported by all compilers, we derive all wrappers from wrapper_traits. 
00020 
00021 template<
00022     class T, 
00023     int Level = object_serializable, 
00024     int Tracking = track_never,
00025     unsigned int Version = 0,
00026     class ETII = extended_type_info_impl< T >
00027 >
00028 struct wrapper_traits : public traits<T,Level,Tracking,Version,ETII,mpl::true_> 
00029 {};
00030 
00032 
00033 namespace detail {
00034 template <class T>
00035 struct is_wrapper_member
00036 {
00037   typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME T::is_wrapper type;
00038 };
00039 
00040 }
00041 
00042 
00043 template<class T>
00044 struct is_wrapper
00045  : mpl::eval_if<
00046       is_base_and_derived<basic_traits,T>,
00047       detail::is_wrapper_member<T>,
00048       mpl::false_
00049     >::type
00050 {};
00051  
00052 } } // end namespace boost::serialization
00053 
00054 // A macro to define that a class is a wrapper
00055 #define BOOST_CLASS_IS_WRAPPER(T)            \
00056 namespace boost {                            \
00057 namespace serialization {                    \
00058 template<>                                   \
00059 struct is_wrapper< T > : mpl::true_ {};      \
00060 }}                                           
00061 
00062 
00063 #endif //BOOST_SERIALIZATION_WRAPPER_HPP
